New Records: Syria secured the Intercontinental Cup 2024 with a 3-0 victory over India, ending Manolo Marquez's first assignment as India coach on a sour note.
Mahmoud Al Aswad scored the first goal for Syria in the 7th minute, and India's defense struggled throughout the match.
Key Match Events: Syria's early goal in the 7th minute set the tone for the match.
Syria doubled their lead with a goal by Daleho Irandust in the 77th minute and another by Sabbag in stoppage time.
India had several chances, particularly in the second half, but failed to convert them into goals.
Pre-Game Insights: Syria only needed a draw to secure the title, while India had to win to progress.
Manolo Marquez, the new coach of India, faced a tough debut as his side struggled defensively.
Post-Match Reflections: The win marked Syria's successful title defense, while India's performance was criticized for its defensive vulnerabilities.
Manolo Marquez's first match as coach ended in disappointment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Gachibowli Stadium in Hyderabad.
India's second-half performance showed improvement but was not enough to avoid the loss.
